description: The Polish Press Agency and GovTech Polska, the Polish government's technology agency, are launching the #FakeHunter app to fight disinformation about the corona epidemic on 8th of April 2020.
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Poland is closing schools and universities for two weeks from thursday the 12th of March to the 15th of March. Speaking at a joint conference following a special meeting on coronavirus, the ministers said that pre-schools and schools would stop teaching on Thursday, but limited care would still be provided this week to the youngest children.
type_sub_cat: Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
institution_status: Preschool or childcare facilities closed/locked down
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Poland is closing schools and universities for two weeks from thursday the 12th of March to the 15th of March. Speaking at a joint conference following a special meeting on coronavirus, the ministers said that pre-schools and schools would stop teaching on Thursday, but limited care would still be provided this week to the youngest children.
type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)
institution_status: Primary Schools closed/locked down
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Other (Please specify in the text box)

type_sub_cat: Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18)

description: Poland is introducing a general lock-down: until April 11 inclusive, people will not be able to move freely outside their living, health and professional goals.
The Polish government is introducing a state of emergency in Poland on 13th of March.

From Sunday, 15 March, Poland will close its borders to foreigners. All Polish citizens who are presently abroad can return to their homeland. International passenger air flights and international rail travel will be suspended for 10 days, with possibility of extension.
target_geog_level: All countries
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: Poland announces that it closes its borders for 10 days starting 15 March due to coronavirus. Poland is imposing border checks.
target_geog_level: All countries

description:
From Sunday, 15 March, Poland will close its borders to foreigners. All Polish citizens who are presently abroad can return to their homeland. International passenger air flights and international rail travel will be suspended for 10 days, with possibility of extension. 
Update: The border closure has been extended with 20 days, to April 13th. UPDATE: The original border restrictions were set to last until March 25th, they are now extended to April 13.
target_geog_level: All countries

description:
From Sunday, 15 March, Poland will close its borders to foreigners. All Polish citizens who are presently abroad can return to their homeland. International passenger air flights and international rail travel will be suspended until May 3rd, with possibility of extension.
 UPDATE: The border shut down has been extended until May 3rd.
target_geog_level: All countries

description:
From Sunday, 15 March, Poland will close its borders to foreigners. All Polish citizens who are presently abroad can return to their homeland. International passenger air flights and international rail travel will be suspended until May 3rd, with possibility of extension. The border shutdown has been extended until June 12th.
 UPDATE: The border shut down has been extended until May 3rd. The border shut down has been further extended until June 12th.
target_geog_level: All countries

description: Polish government cancels all visa appointments as of 18th March 2020 until further notice.
type_sub_cat: Visa restrictions (e.g. suspend issuance of visa)
target_geog_level: All countries

description: The state of emergency in Poland due to Coronavirus has pushed the country to extend visas for all internationals who hold work permits, national visas, or a temporary residence permit, for 30 days after the end of the emergency state, Secretary of Management on Affairs of Foreigners Jakub Dudziak announced.
type_sub_cat: Visa restrictions (e.g. suspend issuance of visa)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
target_who_what: Foreign Residents (Foreign Nationals Residing in the Country)

description: The Polish government is introducing sanitary controls at borders and airports on the 9th of March. The collected data will be used to contact the passengers in case that there is a risk of having the coronavirus.
target_geog_level: All countries

description: In Poland, all procedures recommended by WHO have been implemented in the Polish health system.
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description: On March 12, the Polish government announced that it has transformed 19 medical facilities into infectious hospitals specialised for corona patients.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: The Ministry of Health and the Chief Sanitary Inspector announced that the Protective Vaccination Programme (the vaccination programme with compulsory vaccinations for young children) must be temporarily halted until the 18th of April.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: The Polish Ministry of Health announces on the 26th of March that dental appointments must be limited to patients requiring urgent medical attention. People who require acute dental care but are suspected/confirmed of having the coronavirus must be treated in designated units.
type_text: Restriction of dental services to urgent cases. It is not aimed to preserve health resources, dentists are also not businesses.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On the 31st of March, the Polish government announced that stores that are still allowed to be open must offer disinfectant and rubber gloves to their customers.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On the 31st of March, the Polish government announced that stores that are still allowed to be open must offer disinfectant and rubber gloves to their customers.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: The Polish Ministry of health announces a new online platform called 'Teleporada' on the 14th of April through which an online consultation with a medical worker can be arranged. People who have symptoms of corona can get a consultation without having to leave their house.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: The Polish government announced on the 9th of April a requirement for people to cover their mouth and nose in public, beginning next Thursday the 16th of April. Asked about whether masks will be provided, health minister Łukasz Szumowski replied that a piece of material, such as a scarf, can be used instead.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On June 16th, The Office of the President of the Republic of Poland donated 50,000 protective face masks to Iraq’s health authorities, following Iraq’s request for support in response to the COVID-19 global pandemic.
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description: On June 19, a plane loaded with medical supplies for Armenia took off from the airport of Wroclaw, Poland. The humanitarian aid includes 20,000 medical masks, 2,400 face shields and 2,700 liters of hand and face sanitizers.
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description: On June 25th, Poland will use air transport to deliver to Azerbaijan surgical masks, visors and disinfectant liquid worth nearly 87,000 zlotys.
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description: On June 29th, Poland sent critical medical assistance to Georgia, consisting of around 6,800 protective face shields and 5,400 litres of disinfectant detergent for hands and surface equipment, in response to the COVID-19 pandemic.
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description: On October 10th, "Special coordinating hospitals will open in every province [in Poland], with additional intensive care beds for COVID-19 patients."
As of October 19th, Poland is creating "a temporary hospital devoted solely to COVD-19 patients is being organised at the National Stadium in Warsaw."

Poland announced on the 23rd of March that it would let some prisoners serve their sentences at home under electronic supervision to curb the spread of the coronavirus in prisons. Previously, only offenders serving a maximum of 1 years would qualify for electronic supervision at home, now offenders serving a maximum of 18 months qualify.
type_text: Poland lets more prisoners serve their sentences at home under electronic supervision instead of prison
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: From 6th of April in Poland inmates have limited or suspended opportunities for employment outside prisons and are subjected to mandatory hand disinfection and temperature checks upon leaving and returning to prisons
type_text: The policy limits employment opporutinities for inmates of state prisons
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: As of the 20th of April, all minors under the age of 13 must be accompanied by an adult when going outside (before 20th of April this was all minors).
type_text: Minors under 13 are not allowed to leave the house unaccompanied by an adult.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
As of the 20th of April, all minors under the age of 13 must be accompanied by an adult when going outside (before 20th of April this was all minors).
Upadte: This requirement was annulled from 17th of March UPDATE: As of the 20th of April, all minors under the age of 13 must be accompanied by an adult when going outside (before 20th of April this was all minors).
Update: This requirement was annulled from 17th of May.
type_text: Minors under 13 are not allowed to leave the house unaccompanied by an adult.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: From June 27th to July 31st, The Polish Development Fund (PFR) will pay out some PLN 60 bln (EUR 13.5 bln) in government pandemic aid to small firms, out of the total of PLN 75 bln (EUR 16.8 bln) planned
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: As of July 24th, Poland will double the budget of the Fund for Local Investments to PLN 12 billion (EUR 2.7 billion).

Despite there not being confirmed corona cases yet, Poland has started quarantining people with symptoms or who are suspected cases. On February 27, 55 people were quarantined, after on the 25th of February the Ministry of Health urged people who thought they had symptoms to contact health centres. Update: On March 10, the police started enforcing this quarantine. UPDATE: The original quarantine did not have enforcement measures, on March 10 the government announced that the police would be used to enforce the quarantine.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: The Polish government has announced that all Polish citizens (and foreigners with a residence permit) returning from abroad must quarantine themselves for 14 days after their return. This measure starts on the 13th of March. The police will be used to enforce the quarantine.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Polish government announced that Polish citizens returning to Poland will be quaranteened for 14 days at home from March 15th onwards until. This policy is valid until March 25.
Update: This policy has been extended until April 13.
 UPDATE: The original quarantine requirement for Polish citizens returning to Poland was for those who returned between March 15 and March 25. That period has now been extended to April 13.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On the 23rd of March, the Polish government urges seniors to stay at home to avoid corona infection. The National Chamber of Physiotherapists and the Ministry of Health prepared the preventive program "Active senior at home" so that seniors can stay active within their houses.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Poland announced on the 26th of March that the housemates (family members or other persons you are living with) must also go into quarantine if one of the members of the household has been placed in quarantine.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On the 31st of March, the Polish government announced that minors (any Polish resident under the age of 18) will not be allowed to walk outside unaccompanied by an adult.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
On the 31st of March, the Polish government announced that minors (any Polish resident under the age of 18) will not be allowed to walk outside unaccompanied by an adult.
Update April 20: Only those under the age of 13 must be accompanied by an adult. UPDATE: At first all minors had to be accompanied by an adult if they went outside, now that is only for minors under the age of 13.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Poland introduced a closure of public services; including bars, restaurants (excluding take-out), shops and spas on the 14th of March. 
Update: Measures will be extended until April 11. UPDATE: The Polish government announced new measures on the 24th of March and added that existing measures would be extended to April 11. Also places of worship may now only have 5 people at a time.

description:
Poland introduced a closure of public services; including bars, restaurants (excluding take-out), shops and spas on the 14th of March. 

Update #1: Measures will be extended until April 19.

Update #2: The polish government announced that from March 31st onwards new public services are included in the list: Hotels, cosmetic and tattoo saloons, massage parlours and hairdressers must close. Stores selling household items such as paints and tiles which have recently seen increased custom must also shut at weekends. Shops that remain open must serve only the elderly from 1000 am till midday. UPDATE: Update #1: The Polish government announced new measures on the 24th of March and added that existing measures would be extended to April 11. Also places of worship may now only have 5 people at a time.
Update #2: The Polish government has announced new restrictions, which include the closure parcs of hotels (unless they are using their rooms to host quarantined travellers). So, there are more services which now fall under the restrictions.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Retail Businesses") is closed/locked down

description:
Poland introduced a closure of public services; including bars, restaurants (excluding take-out), shops and spas on the 14th of March. 
Update 1: Measures will be extended until April 11.
Update 2: More businesses are added to the closure of public services on the 31st of March.
Update 3: Stores are allowed to open up on the 20th of April, under strict regulations about the nr of people in the store at one time. UPDATE: The Polish government announced new measures on the 24th of March and added that existing measures would be extended to April 11. Also places of worship may now only have 5 people at a time.
Update #1: Measures will be extended until April 19.

Update #2: The polish government announced that from March 31st onwards new public services are included in the list: Hotels, cosmetic and tattoo saloons, massage parlours and hairdressers must close. Stores selling household items such as paints and tiles which have recently seen increased custom must also shut at weekends. Shops that remain open must serve only the elderly from 10:00 am till midday.

Update #3: From the 20th of April, businesses are allowed to open again under strict conditions. Stores with a surface of less than 100 sq meters may have 4 people per cashier in the store at one time. Stores with a surface of more than 100 sq meters may have 1 person per 15 sq meters in the store at one time. Still, the stores have to observe hygiene criteria (gloves, disinfectant, social distancing etc).
institution_status: This type of business  ("Retail Businesses") is closed/locked down

description: On the 14th of March a closure of non-essential businesses was announced, which included bars, restaurants, spas and most shops. On the 31st of March other businesses were included: Hotels, cosmetic and tattoo saloons, massage parlours and hairdressers must close. On the 20th of April: shops were allowed to open under restrictions. The other businesses remain closed for an undetermined period (including personal grooming, bars, spas etc).

On the 31st of March other businesses were included: Hotels, cosmetic and tattoo saloons, massage parlours and hairdressers must close. description: On the 14th of March a closure of non essential businesses was announced by the Polish government, this was made stricter to include more businesses on the 31st of March. The Polish government has since in steps allowed certain business to open up. on 6th June it will open the remaining businesses: cinemas, theatres, operas, ballet, swimming pools, gyms, fitness clubs, play rooms, and theme parks. Fairs, exhibitions, and congresses will also be allowed. Saunas, solaria, tatoo and massage salons will also be opened (from 30th of May) UPDATE: On the 14th of March a closure of non essential businesses was announced by the Polish government, this was made stricter to include more businesses on the 31st of March. description: Prime Minister Mateusz Morawiecki decided on Tuesday March 10 to cancel all mass events in the country, among other preventive measures undertaken to contain the virus. A mass gathering is defined as at least 1000 people at locations other than buildings, or at least 500 people inside a building.

The Polish government is issuing a complete ban on gatherings of more than 2 persons from March 24th onwards. There are two exceptions: families (i.e. 2 parents walking with their 2 children is allowed) and places of worship (maximum of 5 people).

The Polish government is issuing a complete ban on gatherings of more than 2 persons from March 24th onwards. There are two exceptions: families (i.e. 2 parents walking with their 2 children is allowed) and places of worship (maximum of 1 person per 15 sq meters - before April 20th this was a max of 5 people in total). UPDATE: Originally, only 5 people were allowed to convene in places of worship. On the 20th of April this has been changed to 1 person per 15 sq meters. Other restrictions remain in place.

From October 10th onwards, in Poland, "capacity at cultural events in closed spaces will be capped at 25 percent of the available number of seats, while in open spaces it will be limited to 100 people, with only one customer per five square metres." For 'red zones', "cultural events will be banned"
type_sub_cat: Other mass gatherings not specified above restricted

description: Poland imposes rules for public transport: travellers must keep enough distance so they must leave a row of seats between them. This means that only half the seats can be used.
From October 10th onward, "Wearing masks outside will be compulsory across the whole of Poland"
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks in all public spaces/everywhere
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)
